bboxes.raw_text:
BALDWIN, NY. - Neighbors
of the single Negro family living
in a previously all white area
painted the SWastika and eviction
words off of the home.


Several Protestant ministers
and a rabbi were among the
10 persons who participated in
the repainting program.


The home Of Mr.. and Mrs.
Wesley Mitchell and their two
children was defaced by unknown
persons. The family had been
living in the house less than two
weeks, but they had lived in the
Long Island community for nearly
year.

Negro FumiIy's


House Repuinted

Two elderly per sons drowned
early Sunday while on a fishing
party at the Roosevelt Canal,
at 9th Avenue and Buckeye Road.
Victims we're Mrs. Pernello
Brown. 60. 1742 T.. Line OH. and
Robert A. Brodie. So, 1875 W.
Sherman.


Police reported Mrs. Brown
fell into the water first and
Mrs. Catherine Brodie told her
that she pushed her husband into
the canal to save her friend.


Both drowned and Mrs. BrOdie
and Cleveland Brown were booked
in the city Jail on charges of
drunken and disOrderly conduct.

z Drown
AT Roosevelt CunuI

NEW YORK; A thousand extra
policemen have been ordered to
patrol New York's recreational
areas in an effort to halt teenage
terrOristS.


Police have been assigned to
ride the Staten Island ferry and
city officials may ban beer drink
ing at all city beaches.


Earlier in the week a Negro
armed with knife attacked a
white subway rider without any
rea son. He said he felt like
doing it.

Extru Police
Assigned In NY.

BIRMINGHAM Sunday, June
7th marked the beginning of
church services at the Sixteenth
st. Baptist Church, where bomb
last Sept. Is killed four little
girls and injured 19 others.


The Negro church was rebuilt
with contributions from all over
the world in excess of 100000.


DR.. H.O. Hester, a white min
lister of Montgomery delivered
the main address.


Rev. John H. Cross, pastor of
the church led his congr egation
in the new edifice. Some en-
braced, some wept and some
smiled. Fourteen persons were
baptized and Sunday school SER
vices were held in the basement
where the children had died.

Bonn bed Church
Reopens Doors

ST. LOUIS, Mo. THE Politi-
cal Action Committee of the local
branch of the National ASSOCia-
ton for the Advancement OF
Colored People conducted one
day "crash" voter registration
effort in a housing project that
added more than 500 persons to
the ballot rolls.


Dewey Creighton, chairman OF
the branch's voter registration
committee. directed the drive.
The NAACP Youth Council and
the Catholic clergy assisted.

NAACP Sets Vote


Program In 81. Louis

PHILADEL PHIA - Near mass
hySteria occurred at the funeral
services of Rudy Lewis, lead
singer of the famous Drifters.
The q year old former gospel
singer died of a heart attack
following party at New York
hotel.


Celebrities of show business
were present and a three hour
service caused many in the aud
fence to faint and scream. More
than 600 persons attended the
last rites.

Funeral OF One
The Drifters Is Held

Oakland, Calf. 49, Delta Sigma
Theta Sorority will hold its far
west regional conference at the
bennington Hotel June II, for
members from Alaska, Arizona,
California, Oregon and Washing
ton.


Assemblyman w. Byron Rum
ford, veteran legislator, will
address a public civil right lun-
cheon in the bennington Hotel
at noon Saturday, June IS.


Delegates from Is Of the 81
undergraduate and alumnae chap
terS of the women organization
will attend the conference, which
will be opened by a keynote
address by Mrs. Charlotte II.
Lewis Of Albany. Calf.


The banquet address Sunday
will be given by Dr.. Geraldine
p. Woods Of Los Angeles. natiun-
al president of Delta Sigma Theta.
One Of Americas outstanding
women leaders, she has hJd a
diStmgui shed career in public and
organization affairs aS well Is
you never outgrOW your

DeItus To Hold
Regional Confub
In Oakland

Singer Leslie Uggams, star OF
the television Sing Along With
Mitch, received 500, 900 on her
21st birthday last week. 1t was
a trust fund which was eStab-
lished for her when she started
her career as a child performer.
Singer Gets Trust Fund

Dana j. Dixon, IL, son of Mrs.
Lille May Dixon, 2126 W. Madi-
son, drowned while swimming in
a cement company's pond.


He was accompanied by his
sister, Loren Hayes, &c, 2133
w. Tonic, who said she nearly
drowned trying to rescue him.


Albert Brewer, 3425 w. Mari
copa heard her screams for help
and jumped into the pond and
rescued her.


The drowning occurred at the
United Materials Co., pond
located at 364O N. 10th Ave.

Youth browns,
Sister Saved

Recipients Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority Scholarship
held Sunday the home of Mrs.
j. Ford Smith, 5O25 S. Fl


Mrs. McFradde Martin left, congratuaes the winners.


From Faye Livingston, Jean
Roberts, Newman Bettye Webb Marionee Smith,
High will attend ASH. She plans
singing


of Mr. Mrs Roberts, 110 w. Pima
enter plans teacher.


Lorraine Newman is the daughter Of Mr. and Mrs. James
Newman, 42O8 S. 18th ST., will attend ASU


Emmett Webb Fl 20 E. Parkway
Dr. school. She also the
outstanding senior girl South High.


Perry also received AKA scholarship award
